moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. Nc3 Nf6: Just a standard opening with no real concern for either side.
moves.4. Bc4 Nc6 5. O-O e6 6. d3 Be7 7. Be3 a6: Add a bit of heat, and hope for a mistake.
moves.8... O-O 9. e5: Want to clear some of the center, as we each have some control over it.  Also allows my c3 knight to move to e4.
moves.9... dxe5 10. Nce4 Nd4 11. Nxf6+: Capture and check all in one, hoping for a quick checkmate.
moves.11... Bxf6 12. Qh5: Could of pulled my knight back, but wanted to keep the heat on.  E3 bishop also provides cover.
moves.12... h6 13. Ne4: Pressure seen,  mate not going to happen now, so had to protect my knight.
moves.13... b5 14. Bb3: Another save the piece, on a bit of defence right now and if going to to be lost, at least take some equal piece with it.
moves.14... Bb7 15. Nxc5: Save a piece, take a pawn.
moves.15... Bc6 16. Rae1: Bring the rooks together to either attack or defend.
moves.16... Nxb3 17. cxb3: Needed to keep the game even so had to recapture.
moves.17... Qd5: Black queen to g2 is mate, had to defend, again.
moves.18. f3: And pulled the pawn to keep the queen from mating.
moves.18... Bg5 19. Ne4: Bring my knight to saftey and put pressure on his bishop.
moves.19... g6 20. Qh3 f5 21. Nxg5: Take the bishop, and hoping for a capture so I have access to the king on the h file.
moves.21... hxg5: And it opens so I can move my queen up and out of a bad spot.
moves.22. Qh6 g4 23. Qxg6+: A check and also remove a pawn.
moves.23... Kh8 24. Bh6: Take the offfence and keep putting pressure on him to make moves to protect, also a lone queen can not mate by itself.
moves.24... Rfg8: The rook move  right here lead up to what I believe is one of my best moves I think I have made at move 26, but have to set up for it first.
moves.25. Qf6+: A mistake here and the game is over, and my next move never gets to played.
moves.26. Rxe5: Now black has to pull his queen back or loose it in a few moves.
moves.26... Qd4+: I knew this was a possiablity, but was prepared with....
moves.27. Be3: which puts pressure on his queen, and black has to move or go after my queen which he does.
moves.27... Rg6: And also I had this prepared for as well as you shall see.
moves.28. Qh4+: Check and he has to move his king, or pull his rook over which goes as the bishop on e3 protects.
moves.28... Kg7 29. Bxd4: And now time to take the queen and finish the game.
moves.29... gxf3: Black tries a last ditch effort, but is to late.
moves.30. Rxe6+: Suprise check and more heat on black.
My end game is not very strong, and maybe could of got win a move or 2 earlier, but was excited with the win as I had just started playing chess about a month before.  Now Darren and I are teamates and since I took both games in the 36th tournament, he has beat me 5 times to only one for me.
